title: Business Live: US stocks hit new highs - BBC News
summary: second quarter gdp growth slows to 1.5 % .
uber boss to meet london transport chief .
carillion warns of a slowdown in sales .
london house prices fall in september .

documents.title: good night
text: that 's it for another business live page week .
please join us again on monday from 06:00 .

documents.title: watch : keeping an eye on ai
text: watch : keeping an eye on ai

documents.title: s & p and nasdaq hit records after gains in financial and tech shares
text: the s & p 500 and the nasdaq hit record levels on friday , the last trading day of the quarter , helped by gains in technology and financial stocks .

reports of president donald trump 's meeting with former federal reserve governor kevin warsh to discuss his potential nomination as fed chairman was seen as a trigger for the rise in financial shares .
`` he 's definitely more hawkish on the spectrum , '' said gennadiy goldberg , interest rates strategist at td securities in new york .

the dow jones industrial average closed up 23.89 points , or 0.1 % , at 22,405.09 , the s & p 500 was up 9.3 points , or 0.37 % , at 2,519.36 and the nasdaq composite was up 42.51 points , or 0.66 % , at 6,495.96 .

documents.title: deutsche bank in $ 190m currency-rigging settlement
text: deutsche bank agreed to pay $ 190m to settle us litigation accusing it of rigging prices in the roughly $ 5.1trn-per-day foreign exchange market .
the german lender is the 15th of 16 banks to settle the private investor litigation , which has a total payout of $ 2.31bn .
only credit suisse group has not settled .

documents.title: anger as german ex-chancellor schroeder heads up rosneft board
text: former german chancellor gerhard schroeder is facing a backlash after being elected chairman of the russian state-controlled oil giant rosneft .
the appointment deepens his controversial links with moscow .
he has long been friends with russian president vladimir putin .
the west imposed sanctions on rosneft after russia annexed crimea in 2014 .
the chair of the german parliament 's foreign affairs committee said mr schroeder 's move was `` unbelievable '' .
read more here .

documents.title: when dough goes sour
text: most businesses are aimed at growth and success .
but what if they were n't set up for that ?
what if you 're successful , and then just walk away ?

documents.title: volkswagen diesel emissions fixing bill hits $ 30bn
text: the diesel emissions cheating scandal will cost volkswagen an extra $ 3bn ( €2.5bn ) , because engines are proving `` far more technically complex and time consuming '' to adapt the company said .
the additional cost , for fixing engines in the united states , takes the total bill to $ 30bn .
two years after the problems first emerged , volkswagen is still struggling to put the crisis behind it .
separately munich prosecutors made an arrest in connection with the scandal .
read more here .

documents.title: ex-new york brokerage exec avoids prison over pension bribes
text: a former managing director at broker-dealer sterne agee was sentenced on friday to six months ' home confinement after she pleaded guilty to bribing a former portfolio manager at new york state 's retirement fund in exchange for tens of millions of dollars ' worth of business .
deborah kelley , 59 , was sentenced by us district judge paul oetken in manhattan , who also ordered her to pay a $ 50,000 fine and perform 1,000 hours of community service .

ms kelley pleaded guilty in may , admitting that between 2014 and 2016 , she paid bribes to navnoor kang , former director of fixed income and head of portfolio strategy at the common retirement fund .
mr oetken said that the bribes took the form of paying for two vacations for kang and his girlfriend , and amounted to about $ 19,000 .

prosecutors have said that mr kang reciprocated by steering state pension business to kelley 's firm - doing about $ 156m in trades with the firm in the fiscal year ending march 1 , 2015 , and about $ 179m in the fiscal year ending march 1 , 2016 .
ms kelley received 35 to 40 % of the hundreds of thousands of dollars in commissions the firm earned on those trades , according to prosecutors .
mr kang was also charged with corruption .
he pleaded not guilty in january .

documents.title: supermarket chicken supplier 2 sisters investigated
text: the food standards agency is investigating after reports of safety breaches at a factory owned by one of the uk 's largest chicken suppliers .
the guardian and itv news said workers at a 2 sisters food group site in the west midlands had changed slaughter dates to extend the shelf life of meat .
marks & spencer , aldi , lidl and the co-op have stopped taking chickens from the site while investigations continue .
2 sisters said it viewed the allegations `` extremely seriously '' .
read more here .

documents.title: us senate panel unveils budget plan paving way for trump tax cuts
text: a us senate panel has taken president donald trump 's proposed tax overhaul a step forward with a budget plan for the coming fiscal year that acknowledges lost revenues from tax cuts .
the budget resolution released by the republican-controlled senate budget committee would pave the way for republicans to avoid potential democratic procedural moves to block it .

documents.title: juncker reiterates online tax plan
text: european commission president jean-claude juncker has reiterated that the will propose new rules next year to ensure that companies trading online pay their fair share of tax .
mr juncker told a news conference in tallinn , estonia :
`` we are of the opinion that in the digital sector , tax has to be paid where it is due , be it online or be it offline .
this will have to be done and the commission will propose next year new rules on fair and effective taxation that provides legal certainty and a level playing field for all . ''
fine words indeed .

lest we forget , mr juncker was prime minister of luxembourg during the time the duchy offered very favourable tax arrangements to some of the world 's biggest companies - including apple , ikea , and pepsi - which were exposed in the luxleaks scandal .

documents.title: ryanair rerouting policy 'convoluted ' says which ?
text: ryanair has said it met a demand by britain 's aviation regulator to fully inform customers affected by flight cancellations of their rights before a friday deadline .
but alex neill of consumer group which ?
said :
`` ryanair 's response may get close to complying with the regulations , but it still smacks of a lingering reluctance to do the right thing by its customers .
`` its convoluted four-step rerouting policy means passengers face a potential minefield trying to get to their destination when their flight is cancelled .
the caa now needs to watch ryanair like a hawk .
it must take firm action if the airline is found to be failing the hundreds of thousands of passengers who have been caught up in this mess . ''

documents.title: caa reponse to ryanair changes to website
text: ryanair has agreed to implement measures to ensure all passengers affected by recent flight cancellations are `` fully aware '' of their `` rights and entitlements '' .
the uk 's civil aviation authority has accused the dublin-based carrier of `` not complying with the law '' over its handling of the fiasco .
andrew haines , caa chief executive said : `` we can confirm we have received correspondence from ryanair late this afternoon .
`` our job is to protect passengers ' rights and ensure that all airlines operating in the uk are fully compliant with important consumer laws .

`` where we find that an airline is systematically flouting these rules , we will not hesitate to take action , to minimise the harm and detriment caused to passengers , as we have done with ryanair in recent days .
it appears that ryanair has now capitulated .
we will review their position in detail and monitor this situation to ensure that passengers get what they are entitled to in practice .
`` we are consistent in this approach , and in the last six years the caa has secured 22 legal undertakings from airlines and other travel companies on a range of issues to protect consumers .

`` furthermore , as part of our ongoing work to protect consumers , earlier this month we wrote to over 30 airlines seeking confirmation that they too are complying with the re-routing elements of ec261 legislation . ''

documents.title: could wood pulp make cars lighter and more efficient ?
text: car parts of the future could be made out of a surprising material .
wood .
researchers in japan are working to create a strong material out of wood pulp that could replace steel parts in vehicles within a decade .
work is also charging ahead in the country to develop plastics that can withstand high temperatures , to replace metal for parts near the engine .
these innovations are part of a wider industry push to make cars lighter .
read more here .

documents.title: nearly 200 mps want energy price cap
text: nearly 200 mps want energy price cap

documents.title: ryanair sets out refund options
text: ryanair has emailed customers affected by its flight cancellations in september and october , giving rerouting or refund options .
the civil aviation authority threatened ryanair with legal action on wednesday for `` persistently misleading '' passengers about their rights following thousands of flight cancellations .

documents.title: trump promises 'massive tax cut ' for business
text: donald trump is giving a speech in washington on his tax reform plans .
`` america is winning again , and america is being respected again - on every front , in every way , '' he says
he said he was ending the `` war on coal '' , and said he had approved pipelines and reversed the epa `` intrusion into your business and into your lives . ''
he then warmed to his main theme , saying he wanted to reform the `` outdated , complex and extremely burdensone tax code '' .
`` our current tax code punishes companies for doing business in the us '' and encourages them to leave , he says .

documents.title: germany 's acting finance minister named
text: chancellor angela merkel 's chief of staff peter altmaier will become acting finance minister when wolfgang schaeuble leaves office , according to sueddeutsche zeitung .
mr schaeuble agreed on wednesday to become parliament president to clear the way for someone from another party to take his job .

documents.title: theresa may urged to halt universal credit roll-out
text: families could be left homeless and destitute if theresa may insists on pressing ahead with universal credit , a former top adviser has warned .
dame louise casey urged the prime minister to pause the roll-out of the new benefit system so it can be fixed .
she told bbc radio 4 's pm the consequences for families `` close to the edge '' could be `` dire '' .
twelve conservative mps have written to work and pensions secretary david gauke to call for the same thing .
read more here .

documents.title: popcorn 'fastest growing grocery product '
text: popcorn sales are , well , popping , according to the guardian .
the snack is now the uk 's fastest-growing grocery product as more health conscious consumers turn away from traditional snacks such as crisps , it says .

documents.title: trump meets warsh to discuss fed top job
text: donald trump has had a meeting with former fed governor kevin warsh ( left ) about the job of fed chair , the wall street journal reports .
current chair janet yellen 's term is due to end in january .
the newspaper said treasury secretary steven mnuchin also had a meeting with warsh and that other names were still in contention , including ms yellen .

documents.title: new mayor for the city
text: there is a new lord mayor of the city of london .
not to be confused with the mayor of london , who is still sadiq khan , charles bowman will meet and greet dignitaries on behalf of financial services firms in the square mile .
mr bowman said : the city of london is a national asset for the uk , accounting for billions of pounds in revenue and taxes and creating millions of jobs across the uk .
`` it is also a unique , cultural and diverse institution and it will be an honour to become the 690th lord mayor .
i am immensely looking forward to taking office later this year . ''

documents.title: former tesco execs 'pressured staff to cook books '
text: prosecutors have alleged that three former tesco executives encouraged the manipulation of profit figures , lied to auditors and misled the stock market .
the senior executives were `` cooking the books '' to secure huge compensation packages , and bullying subordinates into compliance , lead prosecutor sasha wass told london 's southwark crown court .
`` the three defendants on trial are not the foot soldiers , '' she said .
`` the defendants in this case are the generals in a position of trust and had huge compensation packages to safeguard the financial health of tesco . ''

christopher bush , who was managing director of tesco uk ( centre ) , carl rogberg , who was uk finance director , and john scouler , who was uk food commercial director ( not all deny charges of fraud and false accounting .

documents.title: bombardier 'may be a lesson for uk '
text: irish taoiseach leo varadkar says that the trade dispute between boeing and bombardier `` could well turn out to be a lesson for the uk '' .

arriving at the eu digital summit in estonia , mr varadkar said : `` when brexit referendum went through we heard a lot of talk about how great a new trade deal between the uk and the us would be , and now we 're talking about a possible trade war .
`` i think it does demonstrate that is every country is a small country .
britain is n't even in the top 20 in terms of population , germany is at 18 .
i think it shows that we are stronger together as trading bloc , and that is something for people to consider . ''

documents.title: supermarket chicken supplier investigated
text: supermarkets are investigating after reports of safety breaches at a factory owned by one of the uk 's largest chicken suppliers .
the guardian and itv news said workers at a 2 sisters food group site in the west midlands had changed slaughter dates to extend the shelf life of meat .
the company said it viewed the allegations `` extremely seriously '' .
it supplies tesco , sainsbury 's , aldi , lidl and marks & spencer , which are all investigating the allegations .
read the full story here .

documents.title: start your engines
text: pirelli has priced its shares for its upcoming flotation , valuing the italian tyre-maker at 6.5bn euros ( £ 5.7bn ) .
its shares will be offered at 6.50 euros each when it floats on the milan stock exchange next week .
the initial public offering marks a return to the public market for pirelli after it was taken over by china national chemical corp and was split into consumer and industrial divisions .
pirelli 's consumer business will float next week which chief executive marco tronchetti provera described as `` a 145-year-old start-up '' .

documents.title: worries over hypersonic technology
text: hypersonics might sound like very loud music , but it 's actually a big deal in the aerospace world at the moment .
it refers to weapons ( missiles and aircraft ) that can travel at five times the speed of sound and beyond .
us defence giant lockheed martin recently said the us was on the verge of a hypersonics revolution .
however , aviation week notes a report from the research group rand corporation .
it says that hypersonic glide vehicles ( hgvs ) and cruise missiles ( hcms ) are so fast , and their trajectories so difficult to predict , that they are hard to defend against .
rand says the spread of such weapons should be controlled , as they could cause regional instability .

documents.title: birmingham bid for 2022 commonwealth games
text: breaking : government announces it is backing @ twitterid bid to host 2022 commonwealth games

a far weaker bid than liverpool but a tory metro mayor over a corbynite .

that 's that ruined then !

documents.title: former tesco directors arrive for trial
text: three former executives at tesco arrived at southwark crown court in london on friday to stand trial over their alleged role in a £ 326m accounting scandal at the retailer .

former uk finance chief carl rogberg , uk managing director christopher bush and uk food commercial director john scouler are charged with fraud by abuse of position and false accounting between february and september 2014 .
they have all denied the charges .
the trial is expected to last 13 weeks ,

documents.title: location , location , location
text: london clocked up its worst performance for house price growth for the first time in eight years according to nationwide .
so how did your region do in september ?

documents.title: brexit divorce progress will take a 'miracle '
text: european commission president jean-claude juncker says it will take a `` miracle '' for talks to conclude divorce terms with the uk by october .
eu leaders are due decide at a summit on 19-20 october whether there has been sufficient progress made on exit terms to then move onto discussing a future trade relationship with the uk .
arriving for an eu summit in tallinn , estonia , mr juncker says : `` by the end of october we will not have sufficient progress .
i 'm saying there will be no sufficient progress from now until october unless miracles will happen . ''

documents.title: consumer credit swells to £ 203bn
text: new figures from the bank of england show that the total amount of outstanding consumer credit reached £ 203bn in august .
however , the growth rate is slowing - down to 9.8 % in august , from 10.4 % in may .
the amount outstanding on credit cards reached £ 68.8bn , while borrowers owe £ 134.2bn on loans and other advances .

earlier on friday , bank of england governor mark carney told the bbc 's today programme : `` we think banks have been giving too much credit and not been as disciplined as they should be in their under-writing standards and their pricing on this debt . ''

documents.title: eurozone inflation below estimates
text: inflation grew at a slower than expected rate in september across the eurozone , according to the eu statistics office eurostat .
prices rose by 1.5 % across the 19-nation bloc compared to economists ' estimates of 1.6 % .
however , core inflation which excludes food and energy prices , was higher than expected at 1.3 % against market consensus of 1.2 % .

documents.title: pound slips after uk economic data
text: the pound has lost some steam this morning , not helped by those soft uk growth numbers .
the pound was trading $ 1.3379 down more than half a cent .
this is how chris williamson , from ihs markit , reacted to the uk growth figures .
fresh economic growth estimates from the office for national statistics confirm that the first six months of 2017 saw the weakest start to the year since 2012 .
`` the new gdp estimates confirmed that the economy grew by a modest 0.3 % in the second quarter after a similar expansion in the first three months of the year .
`` compared to a year ago , the economy was just 1.5 % larger in the second quarter , its worst annual growth rate since 2013 . ''

documents.title: watch : carney 's big hint on interest rate rise
text: the governor of the bank of england has said interest rates will rise if the economy stays on track .
mark carney said the increase could come in the relatively near term .
he did say however that any rise would be dependent on the economy and if it comes it will be only to a limited extent .
the next monetary policy committee meeting is to take place in november .
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: expectations stoked of uk interest rate hike
text: howard archer is chief economic advisor to the ey item club .
carney fueling expectations of near-term hike - # boe close to # interest # rate hikes in november - # carney via @ twitterid

documents.title: services is the only sector to grow in q2
text: commenting on the revised gdp data for the april-to-june quarter , ons statistician darren morgan , says : `` there was a notable slowdown in growth in the first half of 2017 .
the often buoyant services sector was the only area to grow in the second quarter . ''
however , recent data shows that the services sector - which includes financial services and hospitality - recorded a 0.2 % fall in july compared to 0.3 % expansion in june .

documents.title: breakinggdp growth slows to 1.5 % in second quarter
text: uk economic growth slowed in the second quarter to 1.5 % , according to the final reading of gdp by the office for national statistics .
the second estimate of gdp growth , released in august , showed that the uk economy expanded at 1.7 % .
gdp rose by 1.8 % in the first three months of the year .
quarterly growth is unrevised at 0.3 % .

documents.title: toshiba shares rise on chip sale
text: toshiba 's share price rose by 2.6 % on the nikkei after signing an $ 18bn deal to sell its chip business to a consortium led by us private equity firm bain capital .
the nikkei ended down 6.83 points at 20,356.28 .
in hong kong , the hang seng is trading up 96.14 points , or 0.34 % , at 27,517.74 .

documents.title: uber boss to meet london transport chief
text: the chief executive of uber , dara khosrowshahi , has announced that he will meet transport for london 's commissioner mike brown next week to discuss the decision to strip the taxi-sharing company of its licence to operate in the capital .

documents.title: dieselgate costs vw an extra 2.5bn euros
text: `` dieselgate '' is the scandal that refuses to go away .
volkswagen has just revealed that it will set aside a further 2.5bn euros to cover costs related to its admission two years ago that it cheated diesel emission tests in the us .
it adds to the 20bn euros vw has already spent on dealing with the scandal .

vw said on friday : `` the reason is an increase in provisions relating to the buyback/retrofit program for 2.0l tdi vehicles , which is part of the settlements in north america that is proving to be far more technically complex and time consuming . ''

documents.title: german unemployment hits record low
text: the german unemployment rate has fallen to a record low of 5.6 % .
`` employment has , once again , grown strongly and the demand for new employees continues to grow to a high level '' , said the chairman of the federal employment agency , detlef scheele .

documents.title: catastrophes dent beazley 's profits
text: beazley , the lloyd 's of london insurer , has warned that its profits will fall by around $ 150m following the recent series of hurricanes and earthquakes in north and south america .
it says its early estimate of the net cost hurricane harvey , irma and maria and earthquakes in mexico is between $ 175m- $ 275m .
it says : `` currently there is significant uncertainty surrounding the cost of these events . ''
it will provide an update when it announces its third quarter results on 9 november .
shares in the company rose 3 % to 473.70p

documents.title: ryanair 'has behaved disgracefully '
text: aviation minister lord callanan tells @ twitterid `` ryanair has behaved disgracefully towards its passengers ''
get what you pay for folks .
they are cheap afterall .
there are more alternatives now though .
not an airline for me now , lost my trust .
ive always defended ryanair trust has gone now .
never book with them again .
rynair knows full well there will be another punter in the queue
actually not just passengers , but customers !
its along the lines of removing loos and standing room well it is an irish airline
i thought that was their business model !
is that news or stating the bleeeeedin obvious

documents.title: no debt bubble in the uk says carney
text: `` we do n't have a bubble in household debt , '' say mr carney .
he contradicts john humphrys who says debt is increasing .
`` since the crisis british households have paid down a tremendous amount of debt .
`` the level of debt burden relative to income in this economy has gone down by 20 percentage points .
`` in the past year the overall level of debt has just begun to grow in line with nominal gdp . ''
he is worried about `` pockets '' of debt , including credit card debt and borrowing for cars .
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: bank of england 'is very open '
text: commenting on gordon brown 's suggestion that there should be a joint treasury-bank strategic oversight committee , bank of england governor mark carney tells the bbc 's today programme : `` i think we should take seriously how the system has been working and how it works . ''
he says that the bank of england is mandated to notify the chancellor if it believes any taxpayers ' money may be at risk .
the two also meet to discuss the outlook for financial stability and the risks in the economy , the summary of which is made public .
mr carney says : `` i think we are very open about where we see the risks .
we are not holding back about where we see potential risks in this economy . ''
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: what 's next for interest rates ?
text: `` we can see that in the coming months if the economy continues on this track it may be appropriate to raise interest rates . ''
what 's the time frame ?
`` in the relative near-term , '' mr carney says .
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: rates may rise in 'relatively near term ' says governorbbc online and today programme business editor mark broad tweets
text: carney - interest rate rise to come in the 'relatively near term '
is that as close to commitment as he 'll give ?

documents.title: ftse 100 opens higher
text: the ftse 100 has started with modest gains .
it 's up 21 points at 7,343 .
insurance giant aviva is up almost 1 % after it announced the sale of its italian joint venture .

documents.title: carillion shares plunge
text: carillion shares have tumbled 18 % in early trading .
that follows a surge yesterday on speculation that the firm might be the subject of a takeover offer from the middle east .
analysts have been pouring cold water on those rumours and investors have also had to digest some very unpleasant news in carillion 's interim report .
the company has taken further charges for badly negotiated contracts and has warned over full-year sales .

documents.title: fixed rate mortgages will help borrowers
text: the increase in fixed rate mortgages means that households are unlikely to feel much pain from a rise in the interest rate `` providing the economy does not weaken further '' , say nationwide .
chief economist robert gardner , says : `` in recent years the vast majority of new mortgages have been extended on fixed interest rates .
the share of outstanding mortgages on variable interest rates has fallen to its lowest level on record , at circa 40 % , down from a peak of 70 % in 2001 . ''
however , he concedes : `` that 's not to say that the rise will be welcome news for many borrowers .
household budgets are already under pressure from the fact that wages have not been rising as fast as the cost of living .
indeed , in real terms wage rates are still at levels prevailing in 2005 . ''

documents.title: lessons from the financial crisis
text: sir john gieve was deputy governor for financial stability at the bank of england between 2006 and 2009 , a period that saw one of the greatest crises our economy has faced in modern times .
`` our big mistake was not seeing the growing bubble in the financial sector and understanding what a devastating effect that was going to have .
`` we are very unlikely to have that kind of crisis again , '' he said .
the current bank of england governor , mark carney is on the today programme around 8:10 .
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: rate rise will have 'modest ' impact
text: nationwide expects an interest rate rise - forecast by some economists to happen in november - will have `` only a modest impact on economic activity '' .

chief economist robert gardner says that if the rate is raised to 0.5 % `` monetary policy settings will still be a little more supportive than they were before the bank rate was lowered to 0.25 % in august 2016 '' .
this is because the monetary policy committee is unlikely to reverse the other measures it put in place last year to support credit availability in the wider economy . ''
he adds that the bank has signalled any increase in interest rates will be `` gradual and limited '' , with markets suggesting it will rise to 1.25 % over the next five years .

documents.title: carillion 'needs to find £ 500m this year '
text: `` the problem is that they have a negative [ annual ] cash flow of £ 300m , that 's the estimate at the moment , '' said michael hewson is an analyst at cmc markets .
`` if they can get towards the end of the year and increase the amount of money coming into the business by say around £ 500m they should be ok . ''
will they get taken over ?
`` i think it 's unlikely .
why would you want to take it on ? ''
said mr hewson
`` they low-balled an awful lot of bid work and now they are finding they ca n't make any money out of it , '' he said .
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: london house prices fall
text: year-on-year house prices in london have fallen for the first time in eight years , according to nationwide .
prices in the capital fell by 0.6 % compared to september last year .
for the uk as a whole , annual house prices rose by 2 % in september , marginally below 2.1 % in the year to august .
between august and september , house prices rose by 0.2 % to an average £ 210,116 .

nationwide 's chief economist robert gardner , says : `` housing market activity , as measured by the number of housing transactions and mortgage approvals , has strengthened a little in recent months , though remains relatively subdued by historic standards . ''
he adds : `` annual growth rates in the south of england have moderated towards those prevailing in the rest of the country .
london has seen a particularly marked slowdown . ''

documents.title: breakingcarillion : more charges and a sales warning
text: the costs of poor financial decisions continue to mount for carillion .
it has taken a £ 200m charge to cover support service contracts , that have turned out to be much less lucrative than thought .
and it has taken a £ 134m charge to write-down the value of its uk and canadian construction businesses .
as a result the company has warned that full-year results will be lower than current market expectations .
it expects total sales to be between £ 4.6bn and £ 4.8bn .

`` this is a disappointing set of results which reflects the issues we flagged in july and the additional £ 200m provision for our support services business that we have announced today , '' said keith cochrane , interim chief executive .

documents.title: investors bet on carillion share price fall
text: shares in carillion are the `` most shorted '' in london , according to laura foll from janus henderson investors .
shorting involves betting that shares will fall .
mr foll says : `` i think people were shorting it because of the debt on the balance sheet what was n't known was those problematic contracts .
that £ 850m provision took everyone by surprise .
the sheer scale of it was really not expected . ''
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: 'fourth industrial revolution '
text: sean farrington is at a siemens electronics factory in congleton , cheshire .
sean is trying to gauge how successful the northern powerhouse project has been .
he speaks to juergen maier , chief executive of siemens uk .
mr maier says that over the last three years there has been investment in advanced materials and advanced manufacturing in the north of england
`` we want to create the fourth industrial revolution here in the north of england , '' mr maier says .
author: BBC Breakfast

documents.title: uk rate rise 'should have already happened '
text: professor charles goodheart says that a lot of people feel that the uk interest rate should have already risen .

he says : `` the cut of 25 basis points immediately after the [ eu ] referendum was right at the time but in fact the economy has recovered and went on much more strongly then people had thought - that cut should have been reversed arguably quite a long time ago . ''
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: bank independence 'could ' be under threat
text: professor charles goodheart at the london school of economics and a former member of the bank of england 's first monetary policy committee is not sure it can remain completely independent in the future .
he believes that the bank of england 's independence `` could '' be under threat .
`` the key issue is how to you manage financial stability .
but the point of setting objectives you ca n't do it , '' he says .
`` how do you measure financial stability ?
you know what inflation is or at least what the various indices say it it but how do you tell if the uk is more stable today than it was yesterday .
you ca n't . ''
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: china pushes 'green ' car sales targets out to 2019
text: china has set a deadline of 2019 to impose tough sales targets for electric and hybrid vehicles , giving automakers a little more time to comply with the rules which were slated to come in next year .
carmakers will need to accumulate credits for new-energy vehicles equivalent to 10 % of annual sales by 2019 , the government said on thursday .
that level will rise to 12 % in 2020 .
the targets are in line with previous plans but remove the 8 % quota for 2018 .
it 's all part of a bigger push in china , the world 's biggest auto market , to cut emissions and shift to greener vehicles .

documents.title: bank independence 'a bolt from the blue '
text: the decision to hand the bank of england independence in 1997 was not some long-held ambition of the labour party says former mp ed balls .
speaking on the 20th anniversary , ed balls tells the bbc today programme : `` it was n't really discussed at all in the run-up to the general elections .
at the time , interest rates were made by the chancellor ken clarke in a monthly meeting with the governor eddie george - this was called the ken and eddie show . ''
`` gordon brown and i had talked about it many times between 1994 and 1997 and then on the monday before the general election , gordon brown said to me 'i 've been thinking about this .
i think we should do it straight away ' . ''
`` he told tony blair on election day and we announced it the followed tuesday .
it was a complete bolt from the blue . ''
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: from moon base alpha to mars city
text: elon musk the founder of spacex and boss of tesla likes to think big .
he has released a couple of artists impressions of bases on the moon and mars .
mr musk is due to speak at the international astronautical congress in adelaide , australia .
he will speak about his plans for `` making humans a multiplanetary species '' - when he will expand on plans to colonise mars .

documents.title: south korea bans initial coin offerings
text: south korea will ban raising money through all types of virtual currencies , the country 's financial regulator said on friday .
the government said all initial coin offerings ( icos ) will be banned as trading of digital currencies needs to be tightly controlled and monitored .
it follows similar moves from china and elsewhere to crack down on the unregulated digital token '' market , which has bloomed quickly because icos are quick and easy for tech companies to launch .

documents.title: investors still support ryanair boss
text: yesterday the civil avation authority warned ryanair that it faced possible court action for `` persistently misleading '' passengers about their rights .
the cost of sorting out the mess will be around 50m euros says darren mackinley , irish aviation analyst , merrion capital group , dublin .
that 's not particularly significant for a company that is expected to make up to 1.5bn euros in the current financial year , he says .
investors have been giving chief executive michael o'leary `` the benefit of the doubt '' mr mackinley said .
what is less clear is the longer-term hit to the brand points out laura foll from janus henderson investors .
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: the troubles of carillion
text: there 's been drama surrounding uk construction and services firm carillion .
shares surged 16 % yesterday amid rumours that a middle eastern firm might be making a takeover bid .
however laura foll , fund manager , global equity income , janus henderson investors thinks carillion might just be selling some assets in the middle east .
the company reports results at 07:00 .
`` they have a lot of debt , both on and off the balance sheet - they have a sizeable pension deficit , '' she said .

`` the number one thing people will be looking for today is some sort of plan to bring that debt down and they 'll also be looking to see if they 've found any more problematic contracts , because last time we heard from them they had n't even gone through all of their contracts . ''
as well as getting into heavy debt , the company has been getting into contracts `` that they did n't do the proper due diligence on '' .
`` it 's not going to be an easy recovery , '' she said .
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: good morning !
text: welcome to friday 's business live page .
we 'll be keeping an eye on ryanair after the airline was told that , by today , it had to correct its policy on compensations for passengers .
bank of england governor mark carney will be on on the today programme a little after 08:00 .
and troubled uk builder carillion reports results , investors will be keen to hear how the company plans to relieve its heavy debt burden .
author: Ben Morris
Business reporter
